md:
giải nghĩa từ "vote" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

* Vote (noun) - Phiếu bầu, lá phiếu
	+ Meaning: A formal expression of opinion or choice, typically made by raising the hand or by writing a ballot.
	+ Example sentence: "She cast her vote for the candidate she thought was most qualified."
	+ Related words: ballot, election, poll
	+ Antonyms: abstain, boycott

* Vote (verb) - Bầu, bỏ phiếu
	+ Meaning: To express one's opinion or choice by casting a ballot or raising one's hand.
	+ Example sentence: "The citizens voted in the national election."
	+ Related words: elect, choose, decide
	+ Antonyms: abstain, refuse

Note: The antonyms of "vote" are "abstain" and "boycott", which mean to refrain from voting or participating in an election.
html:
giải nghĩa từ "vote" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan và các từ trái nghĩa.

  • Vote (noun) - Phiếu bầu, lá phiếu

    • Meaning: A formal expression of opinion or choice, typically made by raising the hand or by writing a ballot.
    • Example sentence: "She cast her vote for the candidate she thought was most qualified."
    • Related words: ballot, election, poll
    • Antonyms: abstain, boycott

  • Vote (verb) - Bầu, bỏ phiếu

    • Meaning: To express one's opinion or choice by casting a ballot or raising one's hand.
    • Example sentence: "The citizens voted in the national election."
    • Related words: elect, choose, decide
    • Antonyms: abstain, refuse

Note: The antonyms of "vote" are "abstain" and "boycott", which mean to refrain from voting or participating in an election.
